intro: Elettariopsis sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran elettariopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal values. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is of interest for both botanical research and conservation efforts.
